ygData.subject: Re: [cantera]Building Matlab toolbox under linux
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Christian, I didn t modify the configuration script of cantera. It seems that your Matlab install didn t create the link in /usr/local/bin for you. You can

Subject: Re: [cantera]Building Matlab toolbox under linux

Hi Christian,

I didn't modify the configuration script of cantera. It seems that your 
Matlab install didn't create the link in /usr/local/bin for you. You 
can do it yourself. There should be 4 links(matlab, mbuild, mcc, mex). 
Make sure these links work. With these links, the configure script 
should be able to find matlab.

The error message from your 'make' command shows you don't have a 
python module "distutil" in your system. I don't really know which suse 
rpm has it. You can try Yast to find it.

As for the sundials, try this page:
   http://www.llnl.gov/casc/sundials/

Best regards,

Ricky

Quoting Christian Tomasi <chrtom1979@...>:

>
> the first problem I have is while executing "configure" command. It

> Have I to modify cantera configure script? and how in this case?
> Or simply have I to create a matlab script link where cantera can
> find it?

>

> error
> message:
>
> make[1]: Leaving directory
> `/home/christian/cantera/Cantera/fortran/src'
> /usr/bin/install -c Cantera/fortran/src/*.mod build/include/cantera

> build)
> could not import distutils. Will try anyway...
> Traceback (most recent call last):
>  File "setup.py", line 96, in ?
>    raise 'Error encountered while building or installing the Cantera
> CTI file
> p

> preprocessor
> make[1]: *** [_build] Error 1
> make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/christian/cantera/Cantera/python'
> make: *** [python] Error 2
> linux:/home/christian/cantera #
>
> I don't know if this is due to the lack of some packages...I can't
> find
> "sundials" as you have suggested me.
> I have noticed that in the cantera "readme" file they say that
> gcc,g++,g77 are
> needed. I haven't found g++ package too.
> I'm sorry about my poor knowledges about linux, but I have passed
> only
> recently to this system...Thank you very much for your help.
>
> Christian
>
>>  Hi Christian,
>>
>>  The instalation directory is unlikely the reason of the error. It
> looks
>>  like you have the error when installing. Is cantera successfully
> built?
>>  Check the   message again when you type 'make'.
>>
>>  Make sure there is matlab script links in /usr/local/bin or
> whereever
>>  cantera can find. Also, you probably need sundials to build
> cantera.
>>
>>  Good Luck
>>
>>  Li-Chun Chien (Ricky)
>>  Combustion Modelling Lab
>>  University of California, Berkeley
